faq-1.question: How does collaboration with OMGG work?
faq-1.answer:
We start by discussing with the publisher to understand their game, objectives, and audience.

Then, we create a tailored proposal: digital prototype, full version, or companion tool.

faq-2.question: What types of games can you digitize?
faq-2.answer: We adapt all types of board games: card games, board games, strategy, narrative, cooperative games, etc.

faq-3.question: How much does digitizing a game cost?
faq-3.answer: Our projects start at <important>€25,000</important>, depending on the game complexity and target platform.

faq-4.question: How long does it take to get a prototype?
faq-4.answer: On average <important>4 to 8 weeks</important> for a testable prototype, then 3 to 6 months for a full version.

faq-5.question: Does the digital version change the game rules?
faq-5.answer: No. We respect the physical experience and only add features that <important>enrich</important> the game (tutorials, matchmaking, fluidity...).

faq-6.question: Have you worked with publishers before?
faq-6.answer: Yes, our showcase game <important>Vermines</important> and our exchanges with several publishers validate the interest and relevance of our approach.

faq-7.question: On which platforms can you publish a game?
faq-7.answer: PC, mobile, Steam, mobile stores, and even “companion” versions to accompany the physical game.

faq-8.question: How to contact you to discuss a project?
faq-8.answer:
Either at the email address omgg.contact@gmail.com

Or via the form found on the page Submit a project
